snippet: During the three-day convention in Charlotte, N.C., Democrats will focus on the choice for middle-class voters in November by using "real people" to highlight the differences between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney, according to a news report Friday.
abstract: During the three-day convention in Charlotte, N.C., Democrats will focus on the choice for middle-class voters in November by using "real people" to highlight the differences between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney, according to a news report Friday.
